faqs.question: Wie viel kostet diese Immobilie?
faqs.answer: €565,000. This 3-bedroom, 3-bathroom villa offers exceptional value—premium specification at 40% below comparable Spanish island markets. Payment structures can be tailored for qualified buyers, with mortgage financing available through Spanish lenders accommodating non-resident EU citizens.

faqs.question: Können Ausländer Immobilien in Spanien kaufen?
faqs.answer: Yes, unrestricted. Non-Spanish residents, EU citizens, and international buyers can purchase Spanish property without visa requirements or residency conditions. The process involves standard legal procedures, professional conveyancing, and modest acquisition costs (approximately 10% including taxes, legal fees, and registration). Property ownership itself does not require Spanish residency or visa sponsorship.

faqs.question: Welche Kosten fallen beim Immobilienkauf in Spanien an?
faqs.answer: Total acquisition costs typically total 10% of purchase price. These comprise: property transfer tax (3%), notary fees (€400-600), land registry fees (€200-300), legal professional fees (€800-1,200), and survey/inspection costs (€300-500). Budget €565,000 + €56,500 for complete acquisition costs, professional services, and administrative procedures.

faqs.question: Ist die Costa Blanca ein guter Ort zum Immobilienkauf?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Costa Blanca demonstrates consistent +8% year-on-year appreciation with established international demand from investors, retirees, and professionals. The region combines Mediterranean climate, excellent infrastructure, healthcare and education facilities, and strong rental yields (€800 weekly typical). Long-term capital appreciation coupled with lifestyle amenities creates compelling investment fundamentals for discerning buyers.

faqs.question: Wie hoch sind die Lebenshaltungskosten an der Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Moderate to reasonable compared to northern Europe. Groceries average 20-30% below UK/Scandinavia pricing. Dining, entertainment, and utilities cost less than comparable Mediterranean destinations. Healthcare through private clinics remains affordable. Residency for EU citizens involves minimal bureaucracy. International residents typically report 25-35% living cost reductions versus northern European equivalents while maintaining premium lifestyle quality.

faqs.question: Wie hoch sind die Grundsteuern in Spanien?
faqs.answer: Annual property tax (IBI) averages 0.4-0.6% of cadastral value (typically below market value), resulting in approximately €1,800-2,000 annually for this property. Non-resident buyers pay 19% income tax on net rental income. Capital gains tax applies upon sale (19% on profits). Professional tax planning with Spanish accountants optimizes liability for international property owners.

faqs.question: Kann ich als Ausländer eine Hypothek in Spanien bekommen?
faqs.answer: Yes. Spanish lenders offer mortgages to non-resident EU citizens, typically financing 60-70% of property value over 20-30 year terms. Interest rates range €3-4.5% for fixed-rate mortgages. Required documentation includes proof of income, employment verification, and professional conveyancing. Mortgage pre-approval simplifies property purchase processes. Spanish banks increasingly accommodate international buyers recognizing portfolio diversification benefits.

faqs.question: Ist die Costa Blanca gut für Rentner?
faqs.answer: Highly suitable. Costa Blanca attracts thousands of retired international residents, particularly from UK, Germany, and Scandinavia. Healthcare facilities meet international standards with English-speaking practitioners available. Cost of living enables comfortable lifestyles at reduced expenses compared to northern Europe. The established expat community provides social infrastructure, cultural activities, and professional networks. Mediterranean climate supports active retirement. Residency for EU citizens involves minimal complexity.

faqs.question: Wie ist das Wetter an der Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Mediterranean perfection. Winters average 12-15°C—mild, requiring light clothing rather than heavy winter gear. Summers reach 28-30°C moderated by sea breezes preventing excessive heat. Rainfall averages 400-500mm annually concentrated in spring/autumn, with 300+ annual sunshine days. Year-round outdoor activity is viable. Air quality benefits from coastal elevation and mountain breezes. The climate enables comfortable living without extreme seasonal variation.
